section.title: Description
section.p: A student is someone who is formally engaged in learning, especially on enrolled in an educational institution. This class represents information about a Person actively playing the Role of a Student, but is not intended to be used to determine one's cumulative or highest level of educational achievement. While one could theoretically arrive at these data by examining a longitudinal collection of every instance of Person's scholastic activity, we do not require nor anticipate that such information be available. This Student and associated School information exists primarily for Immunization tracking of school-age children.

stentry.p: Indicates the last date upon which the Person was a Student at the associated School.
Indicates the first date upon which the Person was a Student at the associated School.
"A single division of a school classified according to the age or progress of the pupils. In the U.S., public schools are commonly divided into twelve grades below college." - Dictionary.com
An identifier assigned by the associated School to the Student.

"Identifies whether the next of kin/associated party is currently a student or not, and whether the next of kin/associated party is a full- or a part-time student. This field does not indicate the degree (high school, college) of the student or the field of study." - HL7 Version 2.8, NK1-24.
